definition: to confer/to grant/to bestow a title/to seal/classifier for sealed objects, esp. letters
to establish/to found/to set up/to build/to construct
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

sentences.english: Such were the literature and art of the ruling class in China's feudal era.
sentences.chinese: 中国封建时代统治阶级的文学艺术，就是这种东西。

sentences.english: Zhougong's lording or not is an important political issue in feudal society of China.
sentences.chinese: 周公是否称王，在封建时代曾是一个重大的政治问题。

sentences.english: The royal painting institute of China during her feudalistic ages was a formal painting organization for the royal court.
sentences.chinese: 中国封建时代的画院是一种的宫廷绘画艺术机构。

sentences.english: This was the idealistic choice of life for the outstanding intellectuals in feudal age.
sentences.chinese: 这是封建时代杰出知识分子一种理想化的人生选择。

sentences.english: I wont bleed myself dry in this new feudal age.
sentences.chinese: 我不会流血自己干，在这个新的封建时代。

sentences.english: In feudal times, the inappropriate decisions of the successor to the throne often lead to civil strife in the court.
sentences.chinese: 封建时代皇家立嗣处理不好往往会引发宫廷内乱。

sentences.english: He is a typical loyalist patriot of feudal times.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个典型的封建时代的忠君爱国人物。

sentences.english: So" on door read banned" became a feudal era.
sentences.chinese: 所以“雪夜闭门读禁书”成为封建时代一大乐事。

sentences.english: During feudal times, it was a custom to put up prayers for rain during droughts .
sentences.chinese: 在封建时代，有在旱灾时求雨的风俗。

definition: to regard men as superior to women (idiom)

three principles and five virtues (idiom)/the three rules (ruler guides subject, father guides son and husband guides wife) and five constant virtues of Confucianism (benevolence 仁, righteousness 義|义, propriety 禮|礼, wisdom 智 and fidelity 信)
slave-owning society (precedes feudal society 封建社會|封建社会 in Marxist theory)
Confucian thoughts/the thinking of the Confucian school
